Description: Green/blue glazed composition shabti of Psamtek with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard and crossed hands in relief holding an adze, a hoe and the string of the seed-bag that hangs over the shoulder; back-pillar inscribed with Hieroglyphic text that continues beneath the plinth.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum (Department of Architecture and Sculpture)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Museum of Practical Geology
